The Church of Antioch was at that time tom by dissensione, inwhich the monks of the Eastem deserts took a lively interest. They arose from the banish- ment of S. Eustathius, the patriarch of Antioch, in 331, by a council of Arian bishops. Nearly all the Catholics continued to communicate with him till his death, though a few were persuaded by the Ariane to recognize the schismatical patriarchs whom they put into the see. In the year 360 these persons united with the Ariana in electing S. Meletius to the vacarit patriarcham.
